Replies.Reply: Hector is a family man. He and his woman and two children live near the ocean in a sheltered fold on a hillside, a shallow cave given protection at its entrance by a covering of branches and brush. Just inside a small fire smoulders permanently, a few times a day encouraged into life for cooking or warmth. If it ever went out it would be a catastrophe, so it remains a smouldering com-
4000 Warner Boulevard                      WARNER BROS. INC.

is the reflection of Hector's face in a rock pool. The image suddenly fragments. Hector is enjoying himself, deflecting his stream of pee now and then so that his image reforms itself and then is disrupted again. When he is finished, a trace of vanity makes him bend down closer to his reflection. He strokes his long hair and fingers a blemish on his cheek.
Go back home... leave me alone...
No... stay here... stay!
No... go back... go away...
Leave me alone! Stay here...
Up the hill!
Up the hill! They're down there already. I saw them!
Don't move from here. I'll come for you in the morning. There's no food. Try and sleep in the branches. Don't cry. Don't make a noise.
Yes.
Two mice... and some bread...
Two chicken legs, then, cold, and the bread.
When did you hear?
You'll be up for sale before you know it!
He's finished... you reckon?
Well... if he'd pulled it off he'd be in Rome by now...
And me with him... half way home...
Will he lend you the money?
That's a problem.
Have they?
Yes.
It sounds good.
You must.
He kept me working until morning.
He has no money and a lot of enemies. If he's very clever he'll survive... but the omens are bad...
Nobody does. He's unfortunate.
It's the Gods arguing. They're working out what to do with Lucinnius... he'll be lying awake down there... wondering what they're saying about him.
If he goes down I'll ask for my freedom... he owes it to me... he said as much... you too... we could be free...
What we talk about.
and me...
Never. It's you and me now.
Then I can see you every night.
Sorry to trouble you... just fetching a chicken... good night ... the roof's free...
Come on, miss, you can tell Lucinnius his future.
You look happier.
Will he help you?
What if you don't...
I don't know what to say.
I don't understand. What do you want me to do... I don't think I can help you...
know nothing...
What kind of story?
So I'm a conspirator?
Can I sit down?
This is the worst it's been.
But even if it's round you can still fall off the edge.
Do you believe everything that Greek tells you...?
So, where is my home?
Seven.
could you see the sun round there ... I saw the sun at home... every day...
Yes, tell me tomorrow... I'd like to know... because my children are round there and I want to know that they're getting the sun...
It's saying yes... there's a way...
But you asked it if we had to die, or if there was another way... it's saying yes, there is...
Maybe it's just hungry...
Only chickens.
No... but I want something...
I want to die a free man... I don't want to die a slave...
In writing... so that when they find me... they know I died a free man... please...
Thank you.
What do you want me to do?
I understand.
You've done it... you've done it ... lie down...
Close your eyes... you did it...
Lie still... lie still...
Shush... I'll need the knife...
I'm leaving... come now if you want to... but we must hurry...
I have some mail for Tyre... where are the east-bound ships?
We want a timber ship... they go west... straight to Rome...
You can go to anywhere from Rome.
Where is the Captain?
Good morning, Captain... I'm looking for passage to Rome, for both of us...
I'm the steward of Lucinnius the merchant... we have business in Rome... I need an immediate passage...
Of course.
When do you leave?
Keen to start, yes.
Yes, of course.
No... they can't be... they're lost...
A bit cold... walking...
How long to get there?
I thought I heard fighting... back there...
I don't know what you're saying...
I don't understand.
I saw some fighting today... back up the road...
I don't know.    They all look the same to me.
How do you know she's a widow?
You did, Ronald.
I won't be travelling today.
I'll stay.
I think you know what I'm saying ... a little...
How come you don't speak like anyone else? Are you far from home? Home? Where you sleep and live?
over there... then across the sea...
the edge... into nothing. They never came back... they fell off the world...
You think that's funny? It's true... it's a sad story... you shouldn't laugh.
I'm not making sense, am I? Well, let's go back to homes. That's where I'm going... I've been away for too long... Some people locked me up... I had to run away.
We have to learn to talk the same... try it like me, say it...
Home... home... try it... home...
I don't want your word for home, I want you to say mine... home...
Home... home...
Flea... a flea... thanks.
Why don't we go somewhere and have a good session... I could do you... I'd like to give you a good grooming...
Yes, it does feel good.
Got one... a tiny little one...
I don't know your name. I'm Hector... who are you? I'm Hector.
Beatrice.
Beatrice is sighing contentedly now.
Good morning.
You're a busy man, what with all these souls departing.
Nothing at all.
Moving on, as you told me to...
Witch my arse. Stop giving me orders.
You're a strange fellow. Are you a priest? Are you jealous?
You have work to do here.
I don't understand you.
I'm glad we're going the same way.
Why do you smell so wonderful?
He's not moving. He must've seen us, though.
It's a dead man.
Come on, we're going that way at any rate.
No sign of a battle... only a few horses... or just one. He wasn't killed in a fight.
That's good of you.
It's all we can do. It won't keep the wolves away though.
You've put magic in this stuff, haven't you, you're bewitching me...
I don't know what you're saying but I like you when you talk.
We should go now. We've been here too long.
You said mama. I know what that is... mama... We can talk the same...
I have to keep the sun on my back, that's what Ronald said... the sun on my back all the way home...
I stay on this side...
Oh yes... oh yes.
I think we're going the wrong way.
Is there water... to drink... to wash?
No, no... sit down... I just came to watch... please... sit...
You must sit there... look...
Ah...
Good color... for cloth?
Ugh...
Peepee?
Mmmm... good food....
I have to leave soon. I can't stay... it would be wrong to stay for just a while...
smell good... wonderful...
lying under a tree, beside a river.
I think there's more chance of me eating you, Andre.
I have a carpet and some cloth...
At least ask Dona Ursula...
Well... would you take my cloth, at least?
Good work, Andre.
You go and sleep by the big fire, Andre. Keep warm.
Thank you, Nuno.
I'll start with two.
But there's tomorrow, Nuno... we must eat tomorrow too...
Dom Paulo would call it a waste.
Try not to think about Lopo any more... The guards wouldn't let you near him anyway.
Goodnight!
It's foolish squabbling at all.
Some bread and raisins.
Well this wasn't. It's for her...
I must speak to her!
How are they?
Yours were fine?
Have you any eggs left?
You were lucky. What?
You don't like Andre anymore?
We're not going to die, Andre...
I've forgotten your name...
Now I remember why we called you Andre.
I will, Andre... I promise... I'll call you that... when I remember...
Good night... Keta...
Yes... good night...
you stop... here...
Stop that... leave her alone...
Come back... I didn't mean it...
I'm sorry.
Suck out the marrow... it's the best bit.
I'm sorry about today...
But it does... it was mean of me... I was upset at something...
You don't think too badly of me?
You still like me?
You do?
Well, that makes me feel better...
If you don't respect me, just say so...
you could meet him when we get home...
You can take her back there tomorrow, eh?
I'll be glad when we're on the move... the sound of the sea is driving me mad.
Where is Ursula? Sleeping?
Will you share a bottle of wine with me? I've had it since we left the ship... I want to drink it tonight, with you.
Yes.
I know. I feel very guilty.    I brought this too...
Honeyed fruit. The last I have.
I brought it for Ursula...
Surely... some fruit couldn't...
Why is it always me? Why am I always guilty, always sorry... am I so bad?
I had to get home... just like you...
But... the other raft was sinking...
You must come with us.
And afterwards... what will you do then?
Alone?
before we leave.
Ursula... it's Hector.
We're leaving soon. I've come to say goodbye...
I won't forget you... I won't forget India... I can't forget how I hurt you...
We should have talked... I could have explained... many things...
Yes... I'll pray for you in Lisbon... at the Cathedral...
I'm sorry I hurt your pride...
Nothing, nothing...
Ursula?
Francisco, I must talk to you alone...
Francisco laughs softly.
There's no easy way to do it...
Your boots...
Can I have them? You can have mine... they'll be fine for here... but I have to walk six hundred miles...
I'll walk all the way home, Francisco... I'll pray for your soul in the Cathedral in Lisbon...
Yes.
They were made by Da Fosca, weren't they?
How long?
Damn them...
It's Sandy's... whiskey...
It's too high for Indians?
If you did find an Indian, what would he be?
We keep working?
You think we'll get out?
I'm not fast... you're slowing down.
What's the point of having two chronometers when you don't take the average?
You're unscientific, Bobby... at heart...
Seven twenty-five...
Sure this is a good idea.
Hi!   Hello!
Hey, come back... we're just moving through... don't apologize... we all got a fright...
Did you see him?
Was he a Delaware?
Yeah... I think he was an Indian too... What about the horse?
Don't panic, Bobby...
What did you see?
An Indian... with long hair...
Yeah... he was't tall...
Let's get a bit further up.
Some food, the logbooks, my letters, a candle...
No.
What about bears, without a fire?
What?     No... not tonight...
Dear, Father, I miss you. Three frogs are dead. Everybody misses you.  Bring me a bear's head and claws and a gun. School is good.
It's not so funny now as it was.
If you knew him... if you could picture him saying it... it would be funnier.
I'm going home, for the winter...
No.
Tobacco?
I was saving it... you have it...
Well have it now... I don't smoke...
I was saving it for my birthday...
Go on, smoke it... have it now...
I know, Bobby... but that's how I feel about you, too... that's why we're friends... we try hard...
Come on... tell me... who would you rather be sitting here with...
Yeah. He would be a help... but after Daniel Boone...
No we're not... we're going to talk... all night...
So... where do you want to start?
I know where you want to start...
Alicia...
I'm sorry...
What do you mean, you're sorry...
I've said who we are and where we're headed. Want to sign it, write anything?
The peak we logged yesterday...
North?
What's wrong?
Does it have to be bad?   They might be friendly...
I'll do what you do.
They're not going to catch us.
Hold my hand, Bobby...
What?
This isn't really my building...
Where is she?
to him... How are you feeling?
I'll make a couple of calls... I'll straighten it out... is she bad?
She seems in good spirits...
Boris... why did you do this to me? Get down here now... they want all kinds of certificates...
... I need your car... I don't have time to pick up the rental now...
Santiago is talking almost to himself now, absorbed in the mundane mechanics of Hector's building.
I don't really know...
Can I do it Monday?
Can I speak with Leonard, please...
thing... let me know if the insurance is current... I need to know that... I'm on my mobile...
I'll be on the way in thirty minutes at the outside... I can't say... Queens to New Jersey, on a Friday... what do you think?
I'm sorry about your mother...
What?
Well, I wasn't planning to...
I've talked to your mother, given her my best wishes... she wants her family with her now... Any other Friday but this one.
Look, George... here's what I can do... I'll visit her on Tuesday, I'll organize some flowers...
They won't let me leave here...
It's never been this bad, Boris.
What's with the we... it's your problem.
She's a witch... her   bones must be made of steel... she   didn't break a thing... it might   help if you make a visit to the   hospital...
I told you to stop doing that...
Yeah, I'm sorry too... you have to get out of this business... I thought I had...
This is the worst it's been.
You bring my bag?
Sure.   Thanks.
Not much... just like I'm being executed...
I'm glad you talked me into it.
You're right... you're absolutely right... I was ready... I am ready, for everything... I'm fixing all that shit with Boris...
... and the kids... that'll work out... we can have them over sometimes... Yeah?
Right, when we have the space...
Yeah... I said it, didn't I?
Yes I am... Together... I said it ... and get out of my car at the corner here... I don't have the time to go 'round the block.
Thanks... for the car...
What?   Anna, I can't...
Hello... Leonard, hello... yes...
Why didn't you say? I could have fixed up something else. I thought it would be a good place to get to know them again...
Maybe this is a bit sudden for them... Maybe I should have come over a couple of nights and got to know them...
Hi.
Oh no... Jesus save me... what have I done...
No... I can't face it, not just now...
Let's go.
Excuse me, kids... I have to consult the oracle...

Hello... God? No, Leonard, it's Hector... just a joke... sorry to phone you at home, did Boris call you? The insurance is fine? Good ... but she could claim negligence ... oh, she's got a lawyer already? That's a bad omen...
Is there anything we can do right now... make her an offer... Sure, with the insurance company... sure...
That's it! The last call... the weekend starts right now... we have things to do... look out for a Safeway... we need some supplies... and gas... oh my God, gas... soon...
Want to make any calls?    Betsy?
Tom?
But we called you Tom... that's what it says on your birth certificate...
What's wrong with that? It's a kitchen roll... why can't I pick a kitchen roll?
Good point, Betsy...
You're right.
Well, get to it... I'll just tag along...
Don't mention the flowers.
How about some eggs?
You don't eat eggs?
Three.   Is that all right?
How about pancakes, Betsy... d'you like pancakes?
I just wondered. Pancakes don't mean much to you?
Nothing.
I thought we could walk into town this morning. I saw the Funfair when we came through last night.
Let's take the walk anyway.
No.   We're taking a walk.
Here's an umbrella... and there must be some old coats in here...
I don't know if I want to wear Donald's shoes.
Wow.   Look at this.
Six years ago. Look at that...
It comes up every year?
Where are the birds?    Is it the wrong time of year?
That's what Donald says?
Please don't rain... please...
Let's have a ride...
Kitchen roll, unbleached, re-cycled, biodegradable... dry seats...
This is ridiculous. Let's go somewhere and talk.
How do we land these things?
The kids are ready for this.        There is no coyness now.
Well, that's a fair question...
You're right... what can I tell you... I went kind of crazy after that, for a good while... I came around a few times... remember?

Well, it wasn't easy... everything with her and Donald happened pretty quickly. I missed you both really badly... but for a while I thought I should stay away, until your mother got settled... no, that's not really true... I missed you... but I was kind of crazy at the same time... your mother and I married young... I wasn't used to the freedom... it went to my head ... then you moved to New Jersey.
You're right, you're right. I don't have too many excuses for the first year... the second year is easier... I was in jail.

We were doing government work, big contracts... there were some temptations... my boss asked me to shuffle a few papers... there was a lot of money in it... I had to testify against him... it was like killing somebody.
You did?
Well I appreciate that... but I'm glad your mother didn't let you.
I wasn't in great shape... I sure didn't want you to see me then...
Yes. We rent apartments... but we want to get into commercial property... people are a nuisance... does that sound bad?
Just recently I've been feeling good, things have been going well... and I missed you two...
Who told you about her?
Anna... she's nice... she wants to meet you, real soon... she sells flowers... well, you know that...
No... heck... no... did you think she was following us?
She's right, Thomas... people should talk more.
What do you mean? Is that what you thought? I was avoiding you two? No... you mustn't think that... that's terrible...
The rain's off. Let's go.
Go on.
I didn't leave because it was two days before your test... it was just what your mother and I decided... I taught you how to swim... we went to the pool twice a week... why would I leave?
Oh, God, Betsy. I'm sorry.
How did you do, in the test?
Hey, Thomas! We're going home...
Don't call him Tom, he doesn't like it.
Your mother said it, when we split up... don't lose the children... didn't mean much at the time. But she was right.
Betsy.    On Monday will you come with me   when I take the flowers back to   Anna? I can't face her alone.    She wants to meet you anyway.
You'll be there, right beside me?
Is that bad?
Just tell them you were with your invisible dad.
The funny thing is I fell in love with her before I ever saw her...
... but she's still going to kill me on Monday...
It's just like a big pancake up there, isn't it?
I remember when you two were tiny..
I'm not smart about things like that, usually.
No?
Is that a joke?
Who are you?   Who's inside there?
Come on in, kids... that boat doesn't look too safe...
I've just found you... I don't want to lose you. What would I tell your mother... come on in...
Throw me the rope, Thomas, I'll pull you in.
This is one useless piece of rope, Thomas...
I used to know how to do this...
I did... I used to be really good at this...
Ah... smell it... the smell of civilization... scorched meat...
I'd forgotten that... how you eat... dedicated... like it's your religion!
You used to hum to yourself too, when you ate... like everything was fine with the world.
There she is... old Mercury...
could recite them like a poem...
Oh well, not to worry. I'm glad you still like astronomy though.
Uh-huh?
This is at school?
Sounds like Donald said that...

Well, I'm glad you two are thinking about the old planet. I'm proud of you. Look how beautiful everything is. Sometimes I think it's people that make it all wrong... we walk around with all our problems...
Don't worry, you two... I'll tell you... it's just a big, black sheet up there with holes in it so the light comes through...
No... I'll tell you... the whole thing... stars and everything...
Okay... it's half-and-half...
Don't mention flowers, Betsy...
No, down onto the other beach.
You're wrong!
Come back, Dada...
I want to go home to my mother.
You were gone a long time.   Who's this?
I'm hungry.
Mama, are you home?
It's too cold to spend all night up there. We've got a fire at the beach. Food, too.
Come on! Your mother's down there. She's happy... she's warm, too... and full... she wants to see you... she sent me...
That was easy, eh? You're half asleep already, little girl. I'll carry you.
I told you! I knew they did it around here! Ask him...
I tell you, it's one man, one stone. It'll help the voyage.
I don't know, yet.
It's meaningless, without him going over the cliff.

We want to praise God because we live in this ultimate age, when all things are done, all is known, all the wonders of his creation revealed to us... nothing more for man to see or do... all that is left is the hope of salvation...
Yes weep, child, weep for joy...
Fortunate child, destined for paradise. Untouched by the abiding curse of carnal lust.   I struggle against it...
I will not join myself carnally with any woman...
... I will carry my unspilt seed from this world to the next... as should every man...
The DRIVER of the wagon turns his head briefly to the Priest.
Just bread and water for me, Mistress. I have no need of wine or meat.
God, I'm starving. Do you think I dare heat that up on the fire?
No... I'll eat it cold... I deserve to suffer.
Have some wine.
So, the mad knights are at it again... what were they, Swiss or English?
It might help us get through...

But, Hector, you must keep out of the way of temptation... I saw the way you were eyeing up that widow... now stay away from that... although she is beautiful, is she not... but we're going home, remember.
Look at her eyes... hungry eyes...

Listen, Hector, let's get this clear... if anyone's going to dally with that widow it'll be me... you couldn't handle her... she'd bewitch you... at any rate, you're not a sinning kind of fellow, are you... why don't you get off up the road tomorrow, and I'll catch you up, in five or so days...
You're not a sinning fellow, remember... another month and we'll be at the channel, then home... the little ones you only talk about when you're drunk...
Why do I always talk so much...
Who saved your neck in Venice?
And don't you forget it.
May the Lord forgive us our sins, those we have committed and those we as yet only dream of. She's a glory of a woman.
The fighting's behind us, brother ... you'll be safe enough.
You should go.
Sleeping now... at peace, for the moment.
Goodbye, little girl... the Lord will bless you, I know, in his house.
How long for you on the road?
Good luck to you.
The Saxon, won't he go with you?
Lie still, Peter...
Peter...
There's nothing wrong with helping someone to die in peace. They want me to go with them.
Are you staying here?
She'll do you harm. I told    you.
So, you're leaving?
I'll comfort them whether they live or die, now or later, any of you, all of you... I'll comfort you all.
What do we do? Do we throw you over, is that the idea?
He wants me to throw you over.
What's it got to do with the sun?
No.  It's too much of a risk.
Off you go.   We don't want you.
I'm going to the cool room.
Bad omens, Hector. Bad omens.
He's a true friend, probably the only one I have left.
He was honest about it. He said so, plain and simple. No.
And the ships have gone... did I tell you that?
Cyprian knows already. He'll want his money back too...
When we get home I want you to get some chickens... and fetch Hermas, the diviner.
Are my ships from Sicily still afloat...?
What do you mean?
could've found your family...
It does, doesn't it!
I shouldn't give up. I can't...
You're right.    I must.
finish the lamps.
Lower, Thalia.
I can't sleep. Get me a chicken.
Relieved anyway... relieved that it's over at last.

I have to kill myself by tomorrow morning. He has all my letters to Titinius, none of them got through. He says it's like treason... and he says I should want to die for owing him half a million anyway...
Then he will... and that wouldn't be pleasant... he would drag me to Rome... those letters...
I'm done for, Hector... but it's strange... I feel kind of good about it... the struggle is over ... we've seen it through together, eh?
Let's get home. We have a lot to do.
Tonight... peace at last...
We'll do it with a knife, Hector.
We'll help each other, Hector. We must. We've been through this whole mess together... we must die together.
You don't understand do you? I'm asking you to die with me...
Hector... at Cyprian's this morning ... I had to sign certain papers ... tell a bit of a story...

A confession. That we were plotting against Cyprian and the provincial senate... we were short of names... most of the people I know were in the room... people I thought were my friends... so I mentioned you... I had to...
Yes. So you see, I don't want you to die with me just because of my honor... it's more complicated...
Of course.
If he eats the grain it means yes.
No, it's saying yes, we should die.
No, it's saying yes, we should die.
Thank you, gentlemen... But I feel that I will be capable of taking care of my affairs tonight without your help... Thank Cyprian for his kind thought...
Thank you.   Good night.
Thank you.
Eight hundred sesterces... cash ... that's all that's left... what a failure... my father left me three farms and forty thousand...
Nothing else to be done.    Don't you want some wine?
What is it?
Hector,    by this proclamation, I make you    a freed man... I don't know the    exact words... I've never done it    before... But you're free, Hector.
Very well...
They'll find it in the morning.
Lucinnius picks up a large kitchen knife which lies on the table. He fingers its blade.
Nothing... I mean, not to me... I have to do it first... you understand that... and then you...
No point in messing up the room.
Oh, that hurts, that stings!
This is hopeless.
Help me, Hector...
Thank you, thank you.
You do it now, Hector... hurry...
Do it Hector... do it... you promised...
Take it... do it...
Do it, Hector... do it... do it...
Do it... do it... do it...
No mice.
Of course you're free to call at my house at anytime, but I was receiving Nepos... how could I admit you?
No, no... offer the grain first...
... and we can't ask the Gods specific questions like that...
General answer... no...
I mean, no.   The liver says no...
If you want to do it  again, you need another chicken  and another fifteen sesterces...  and I'd like the first fifteen now  please.
I missed you last night.
What's happening?
She doesn't like him.
Why does the thunder always stay out on the ocean?
Then what?
We talk about going home. Yours is that way and mine is that way... your family is that way.
It's what you talk about.
I don't understand. I think you'll leave. You're going to leave me here.
speaks.
Hector hurries on, noncommittal in his reply.
Where's the land gone?
Have you been on a ship before?
Me, too, but they kept us down there.
Tonight... we'll be where the thunder is!
Can't you find a woman, Hector...
When they're dead they go over the side... The place stinks enough as it is...
No... it's not round like that...
Rome must be right in the middle...
How many months did they march you here?
His fingers stop on the other side of the ball.
But then you'd be upside down...
new tenderness.
I think I know that... they're out here, and all around... that's how they can look down and see everything...
Solus!
Solus... I'm eating chicken again.
It's what we have to hand in the kitchen, ma'am... I always try to use the fresh stuff... the chickens have just been turning up...
Two men have come to see you.
They want to make a visit here...
He was excited when he heard you had come, but he wants to know if you are real people... he didn't think you would be such a strange color... so he wants to see your...
... so that he will know that you were born like real people...
He wants to see you breathe.
very far away... this way...
He says he could not accept such a treasured gift, something of such value to your family...
you across the first of the big rivers... it is ten days from here...
... and he asks you to be ready to leave the beach in two days time... he cannot permit you to stay longer...
Because with the new moon the turtles will arrive and lay their eggs... you may frighten them... you must be gone...
Yes... they will look after the sick... but the King would like one thing... the machine that makes music...
comfortable... as you could wish...
We're   spending the night at the house   of Nepos, not far from here.
We'll call in the morning at any rate... just to make sure.
You.    Come here.
He looks like the kind that'll want some help. Have you ever killed before?
